metadata.title: CVE-2019-13709 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in downloads in Google Chrome prior to78.0.3904.70 allowed a remote attacker to bypass download restrictions viaa crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13709` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
